references.paper_title: College admissions and the stability of marriage
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of matching theory, introducing the deferred acceptance algorithm which is central to the current work.

references.paper_title: The evolution of the labor market for medical interns and residents: A case study in game theory
references.reason: This paper is a seminal application of matching theory to a real-world problem, demonstrating its practical impact and influence on the field.

references.paper_title: The economist as engineer: Game theory, experimentation, and computation as tools for design economics
references.reason: This work highlights the importance of game theory, experimental analysis, and computation in economic design, relevant to the learning and stability aspects in matching markets.
This paper is a significant contribution to the study of bandit learning in matching markets, which serves as a basis for addressing the stability challenges of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Improved bandits in many-to-one matching markets with incentive compatibility
references.reason: This paper addresses a more general setting, showing advances in bandit learning for many-to-one matching, thus contributing to the broader applicability and relevance of the current work.
